did.unittitle: Crittenden, Mabel and Alan Grundmann, “Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve,” 1983
Docent Days at Jasper Ridge, Spring 1980
Docent Training Courses, syllabi and notes, 1983-85
Geology and Biology of Serpentine Soils, Biology 178 papers, Spring 1974
Grasses at Jasper Ridge, list, 1983; and “Some Grass Facts (and Rumors)” 1982-83
Grundmann, Alan, “Present Thinking about Searsville Planning Questions,” March 1977
A guide to Jasper Ridge; prepared by the students of Biology 178, Spring 1972
Harvey, Alan and Richard Jeffers, “The Amphibians and Reptiles of Jasper Ridge,” Biology 199, June 1981
Holm, Dick, “Report on Searsville Lake,” ca. 1971
Important Jasper Ridge historical dates, list of, 1979
Improvements, update to Jasper Ridge Committee, 1978
Introductory Training of Jasper Ridge Docents, Winter Quarter 1978
Introductory Training to Jasper Ridge Docents, Spring Quarter 1978
Inventory of JRBP – Experimental Ecological Reserves, ca. 1975
Jasper Ridge / San Francisquito Creek Waterways Paper (Alan Grundmann), 1982
Jasper Ridge and the Man and the Biosphere Program, memo from Nona Chiariello with supporting documents, 1987
Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve Management and Major Research Facility Requirements: 1975
Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve, A University policy statement concerning academic program, community use, management, and financing. March-June 1974
Jasper Ridge publications, theses, and dissertations (lists of), 1969-89
Jasper Ridge: History of Public Exclusion (concerns closing off horse trails)
JRBP book [Jasper Ridge: A Stanford Sanctuary] – emails regarding research, drafts for several chapters, and a brochure on the book

JRBP publications: Common Plants, Common Birds, Jasper Ridge Biological Experimental Area, Views from the Ridge (Spring 1984), Views Fall 1992, Wildflower calendar 1985, Jasper Ridge: Stanford’s Biological Preserve, and The Searsville Site Guide
Layport, Cindy, “Assembling a Vertebrate Collection,” ARLO project, Spring 1982
Subjects include silting along Corte Madera Creek, research projects, and visit by Bechtel.
Memoranda, mostly by Alan Grundmann, 1973 Jan. - April
Subjects include funding issues, Trustee designation of JRBP, Shack Riders and horse trail issues, neighbor relations, chaparral control, camping request, and development.
Memoranda, mostly by Alan Grundmann, 1973 May – August
Subjects include Shack Riders and horse trail issues, Jasper Ridge incursions, development plan, zoning, funding issues, cattle on Jasper Ridge, Bechtel visit, and fencing issues.
Subjects include management plan, Swamp trail problems, horse trail problems, chimp food garden, tours, fire road, signs, Searsville bomb threat, and fencing.
Subjects include docent training, use of motor vehicles, mosquito abatement, insecticide use, office space, NSF facilities proposal, and boundary with SLAC.

Subjects include research visits, docents, steelhead ladder at Lagunita Dam, mosquito abatement, office space, Lawrence Hall, Jasper Ridge Policy Committee, Searsville Lake swimming use, preserve boundaries, and buffer zone planting.
Subjects include JRBP emblem, planning (includes draft of future goals), mosquito project, state park research possibilities, equipment, milfoil, fence plantings and boundary with SOPF.
Subjects include scattering ashes at JRBP, camping, parking JR truck, regulations for conduct, funding, docent training, proposal for lysimeters, diversity enhancement, and fire road.
Subjects include JR vegetation map and SLAC biological survey of San Francisquito Creek.
Mill, Ted, “Photooxidizing Properties of Searsville Lake,” presented at annual Jasper Ridge Seminar, Feb. 1985
Miscellaneous materials (includes maps, fact sheets on JR birds, short descriptive pieces on JR)
Nishimoto, Judy, “The Social History of the Jasper Ridge Area (summary of a lecture give by Mrs. Dorothy Regnery)”, 1978
Notes on Trifolium by Herb Dengler (photocopy) 1982
Plant and lichen lists 1988 and undated
Policy Statement and Management Program for the Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve, Dept. of Biological Sciences, Spring 1975
Proposal for Jasper Ridge Bird Committee, 1975
A Request for the Addition of Area 8 and Parts of Area 4B of the Stanford Lands to the Academic Reserve of the University, submitted by the Dept. of Biological Sciences, October 23, 1956
Research permits issued to persons not affiliated with Stanford University since circa 1975, 1982
School Use of Searsville Lands, draft guidelines, 1978
Searsville Lake Leasehold vis-à-vis the Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve, draft for a University Position Paper, October 1976
Searsville Park Exploratory Meeting with Ad Janes, Agenda, 1973
Searsville Project Guidelines (Jasper Ridge Visitor Facilities), 1983-1984
Seasonality on Jasper Ridge, Biology 178 papers, Spring 1975
Sign: closure of Searsville Park, summer 1977
Sims Memorial Fund, memos and correspondence, 1973
Tentative Proposal to the NSF on behalf of the Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve, general draft #1, May 1979
Thomas, John “Appendix I” – list of Jasper Ridge papers, conduct regulation, cost calculation, and CV for 5 professors, 1975
Thomas, John, “The Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve Teaching and Reference Collection of Vascular Plants,” 1992
Topics in Ecology, Biology 178 papers, Spring 1973
Wessells, Norm, draft of memo on management plan and letter about association of JRBP with UC Natural Land and Water Reserves Sytem, ca. 1973
White, Ray, “Geology of Jasper Ridge,” Bio. 115, undated
Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve Stanford University. Includes sections on tours, trails, geology, plants, animals, ecology, research, etc. [circa 1982]
Lists, 1985-90, of tours given, docents, SCVAS, checks deposited
New Roses Gallery Show (included JR images), 1975 – advertisement, mailing list, Herb Dengler's write-up for the event
Stanford Magazine article, 1975 – drafts and correspondence
Catalogs from Oakland Fence Co., Cyclone Fence, and Page
Lawrence G. Brian and Co. Specifications and Contract documents
Cheap buildings – info on cheap storage buildings
Paint all buildings – expenditure statements, project funding authorization, proposals, 1985-86
Low-flow crossing and weather station, correspondence, 1970-72
Westridge fence, 1968-70 – letters and legal documents regarding Rachel H. Fairweather Fund, letters regarding JR Fencing Proposal and JR Improvement, and letters about future plans for use of JR
Westridge fence, letters and estimates, March 1970
Ladera Dam, reports, letters, articles, and other materials, 1961-62
Stanford Outdoor Primate Facility, letters, papers, article, 1969-81
Cattle, 1958-80 – letters from Paul Ehrlich regarding cattle in serpentine, map of fence, and miscellaneous letters
Grazed grassland preserve, 1975-77 – letters re grazing in the SLAC corridor
Shack Riders, 1960-74 – pamphlet, letters regarding proposed creek crossing, horse trail maps, letters re new shack site
State of California – EPA fund proposal

odd.head: General note
odd.p: 1 file added to SC restricted files: Confidential materials on Page Kennedy wedding; George Pegelow employment
